sentence: I tried to make a tiny blueberry pie but it ended up being a little tart.
first_new_sentence: The dessert served at the party was a lemon tart.
second_new_sentence: The fruit had a unique flavor, so it was especially tart.

sentence: Two antennas got married the wedding wasnt great but the reception was amazing!
first_new_sentence: The hotel offered a warm reception to all its guests.
second_new_sentence: The reception for the radio signals was crystal clear.

sentence: What did the river say when it saw the beavers? Ill be dammed.
first_new_sentence: The construction crew built a dammed reservoir for the towns water supply.
second_new_sentence: The river was dammed, causing a rise in the water levels upstream.

sentence: In these examples, the selected word(s) from each joke have two distinct meanings, spelled the same way, and the new sentences accurately reflect both meanings in a serious context.
